Definition: In this task, you will be shown a sentence, and you should determine whether it is overruling or non-overruling. In law, an overruling sentence is a statement that nullifies a previous case decision as a precedent by a constitutionally valid statute or a decision by the same or higher ranking court which establishes a different rule on the point of law involved.#ADecision #YouItSentenceThatWhich #ThisTask #AnOverrulingSentence #Law #It #TheSameOrHigherRankingCourt #AConstitutionallyValidStatute #ASentence #ShownSentence #APreviousCaseDecision #ADifferentRule #Sentence

Positive Examples.explanation: The word "disapprove" shows that cooper and craven case isn't valid anymore and it's a overruling sentence.
It's a good example. This sentence doesn't overrule any law, So it's non-overruling.

Negative Examples.input: alvarez-machain'?, cursory analysis contains two errors that lead us to overrule it.
Negative Examples.explanation: This sentence doesn't overrule any rule, So it is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input: apparently every other circuit has decided that the reasons against having the rule outweigh those that favor it, at least where the supreme court issues a decision that upsets precedent relevant to a pending case and thereby provides an appellant with a new theory or claim.
Negative Examples.explanation: This sentence disapproves the decisions of the fourth district, So It's overruling.

Instances.input: any language to the contrary in prendiville or other cases is overruled.
